paragraphs.text:
%md
## OML4Py Data Transformation: One Hot Encoding
In this notebook, we demonstrate how to do one hot encoding using OML4Py.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

**Note**: If the user plans to use the in-database algorithms, one hot encoding is automatically applied for those algorithms requiring it. The in-databae algorithms automatically explode the categorical columns and fit the model on the prepared data internally. For more details, see [GLM model](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/machine-learning/oml4sql/21/dmcon/generalized-linear-model.html).

Copyright (c) 2020 Oracle Corporation                             
###### [The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0](https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl/)
---

OML4Py Data Transformation: One Hot Encoding

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to do one hot encoding using OML4Py.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

Note: If the user plans to use the in-database algorithms, one hot encoding is automatically applied for those algorithms requiring it. The in-databae algorithms automatically explode the categorical columns and fit the model on the prepared data internally. For more details, see GLM model.

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Import libraries and set display options
paragraphs.text:
%python

import pandas as pd
import oml

pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 500)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 500)
pd.set_option('display.width', 1000)

paragraphs.title: Get a proxy object to CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV and subset of columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_DF = oml.sync(schema = 'OMLUSER', table = 'CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV')
cat_cols = ['MARITAL_STATUS', 'STATE', 'GENDER', 'REGION']
CUST_CAT_DF = CUST_DF[['CUSTOMER_ID'] + cat_cols]
z.show(CUST_CAT_DF.head())

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

CUSTOMER_ID	MARITAL_STATUS	STATE	GENDER	REGION
CU14048                   	MARRIED	NY                        	M                         	NorthEast
CU14049                   	MARRIED	NV                        	M                         	Southwest
CU14050                   	SINGLE	MI                        	M                         	Midwest
CU4614                    	OTHER	TX                        	F                         	Southwest
CU4615                    	SINGLE	MN                        	M                         	West

paragraphs.title: Create function for one hot encoding
paragraphs.text:
%python

def encode(DF, ids, col):
    assert isinstance(ids, list)
    CNT_DF = DF.crosstab(ids, col)
    PIVOT_DF = CNT_DF.pivot_table(ids, col, 'count', aggfunc = oml.DataFrame.count)
    cols = PIVOT_DF.columns[len(ids):]
    new_columns = [ col + '_' + c.split('_')[1][1:-1] for c in cols]
    new_columns = ids + new_columns
    PIVOT_DF.rename(columns = new_columns)
    return PIVOT_DF

paragraphs.title: Apply one hot encoding to MARITAL_STATUS column and check the transformed data

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

msg.data:
CUSTOMER_ID	MARITAL_STATUS_DIVORCED	MARITAL_STATUS_MARRIED	MARITAL_STATUS_OTHER	MARITAL_STATUS_SINGLE	MARITAL_STATUS_WIDOWED
CU1                       	nan	nan	1.0	None	None
CU10                      	1.0	nan	nan	None	None
CU1000                    	nan	1.0	nan	None	None
CU10000                   	nan	1.0	nan	None	None
CU10001                   	1.0	nan	nan	None	None

paragraphs.title: Apply one hot encoding to all selected categorical columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

RES_DF = CUST_CAT_DF[['CUSTOMER_ID']]
for i, col in enumerate(cat_cols):
    if col == 'CUSTOMER_ID':
        continue
    ONEHOT_DF = encode(CUST_CAT_DF, ['CUSTOMER_ID'], col)
    RES_DF = RES_DF.merge(ONEHOT_DF, on ='CUSTOMER_ID', how = 'inner', suffixes = ['', ''])
    
z.show(RES_DF.head())

paragraphs.title: Replace None and nan values with 0
paragraphs.text:
%python

cols = RES_DF.columns[1:]
for col in cols:
    RES_DF = RES_DF.replace(old = [None], new = [0.0], default = 1.0, columns = [col])
